abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Emergency Economic
            and Social Reunification Support Project for the Democratic
            Republic of Congo (DRC) are: (i) to assist the Borrower in
            its efforts to economically and socially reunify the Eastern
            provinces to the rest of the country; and (ii) to increase
            access to and use by the local population of basic
            infrastructure and social services in the provinces of
            Orientale, Maniema, Nord Kivu, Sud Kivu, Nord Equateur, Nord
            Katanga, and Nord Kasai Oriental. Ratings for the project
            development objective and the overall implementation
            progress have been consistently 'satisfactory'
            since the project was restructured in September 2008, and
            the Government's commitment to the project remains
            strong. The results achieved on the ground have greatly
            contributed to improving the living conditions of the
            populations. The project has been instrumental in helping
            the country achieve the reunification of its economic
            activities and has supported social reunification. The
            project has also contributed to jumpstarting the economy in
            the eastern part of the country which had been cut off from
            the other parts of DRC for several years and the project
            objectives continue to be achievable.
